Sentencas: Oxygen-stoichiometric La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites and the corresponding reduced specimens, of La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3-delta composition, have been prepared and characterized by x-ray diffraction and neutron powder diffraction (NPD), in complement with thermal analysis, electrical conductivity, and thermal expansion measurements.
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: NPD data show that these perovskites are all orthorhombic, space group Pbnm (No. 62).
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The total reduction of M3+ to M2+ in the reduced phases is accompanied with the occurrence of oxygen vacancies, which was confirmed by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Above room-temperature, these phases undergo two structural phase transitions studied in situ from NPD data; the former to a tetragonal (I4/mcm) structure, and the second one to a cubic (Pm-3m) phase.
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All the oxides display a semiconductor-like behavior with a maximum conductivity value of 15 S center dot cm(-1) for the oxidized La0.5Sr0.5 Mn0.5Ti0.5O3 phase at 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The measured thermal expansion coefficients perfectly match with the values usually displayed by solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolytes.
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The obtained results present these perovskites as alternative electrodes for SOFCs.
Titulo: Neutron structural characterization and transport properties of oxidized and reduced La0.5Sr0.5M0.5Ti0.5O3 (M = Mn, Fe) perovskites: Possible electrode materials in solid-oxide fuel cells
